title: Report Shows Growth In Multiple Ethereum Layer 2 Networks; Polygon Leads The Pack - ZyCrypto
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Layer 2 networks on Ethereum are experiencing rapid growth, with Polygon leading the pack. Polygon has seen a 30% increase in daily users and a 40% increase in transaction volume, resulting in $55,000 in daily network fees. Arbitrum has grown by 40% and now has 41,695 daily users, with a market share of 52% in terms of total value locked (TVL). Optimism has recorded a 180% increase in daily network fees and 190% spike in daily users. Polygon is tipped to have a more robust development in 2023, with multiple projects set to migrate from rival networks.

title: Ethereum stablecoin dominance reaches 3-month high - CryptoSlate
summary: Ethereum's dominance over stablecoins has reached a 3-month high, according to Glassnode data analyzed by CryptoSlate. The ETH market cap has been consistently higher than the aggregate value of the top 4 stablecoins (USDT, USDC, BUSD, and DAI) since the beginning of 2020. However, stablecoins briefly surpassed ETH in value in July and November 2022. Exchanges' stablecoin reserves have been shrinking since the FTX collapse, and the ETH price has been on an upward trajectory, reaching around $1,623 at the time of writing, a 33.23% increase in the last 30 days.

title: Ethereum and Cardano Record Highest Level of Developer Activity in 2022: DappRadar - CryptoPotato
summary: Ethereum and Cardano had the highest developer activity in 2022, according to DappRadar, with 223 and 151 average daily devs, respectively. Despite a 26.47% decrease in developer count, Cardano managed to retain its position. Other notable blockchains with high developer activity include Polkadot, Kusama, and Cosmos, which saw increases of 16.06%, 12.80%, and 117 average daily developers, respectively. Solana and Internet Computer (ICP) also saw significant increases in developer activity, with a growth of 1,320% and 1,050%, respectively. However, the overall number of daily active developers on blockchain networks declined by 31.4% over the past 30 days.

title: Crypto Prices Today: Bitcoin (BTC) Loses 0.34%, Ethereum (ETH) Up 0.64 - Outlook India
summary:

Crypto prices were mixed today, with Bitcoin down 0.34%, Ethereum up 0.64%, and global market capitalization up 0.64%. Total volume decreased by 14.05%.

title: The US Government Wants You To Know It's Cracking Down on Crypto - Decrypt
summary: The US government is cracking down on cryptocurrency, with the Department of Justice announcing an "International Cryptocurrency Enforcement Action" and charging a Hong Kong-based, Russian-owned exchange called Bitzlato with processing illicit funds, including ransomware proceeds. The move is seen as a flex by the government to show it's aware of cryptocurrency crime and taking decisive action, following the collapse of FTX. The SEC has also charged crypto lenders Genesis and Gemini for violating securities laws. The industry is concerned about overreach and the potential for new regulations that could harm retail investors.

title: Where can you invest in Ethereum? - Guardian Nigeria
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Investing in Ethereum can be done through various methods, including trading platforms, crypto ATMs, and exchange platforms. Each method has its pros and cons, and it's essential to choose the right one based on your level of expertise and preferences. The article highlights the benefits of investing in Ethereum, such as its global acceptance and potential for generating massive profits. However, it also emphasizes the importance of gaining knowledge and selecting the right platform to avoid any issues.
